description: Employers can use Universal Jobmatch to create an account, advertise jobs online and automatically match them to suitable jobseekers.
title: Universal Jobmatch: vacancies placed by employers

transaction.title: Universal Jobmatch: vacancies placed by employers

description-extra: The service was introduced in November 2012.
costs:
This process is part of Jobsearch Advice service and all the costs are already included in the unit cost of Adviser Interventions (jobsearch advice) 
The costs for 2012 to 2013 included the costs of its predecessors, Employer Direct, National Email Team, Jobseeker Direct Online.
other-notes:
The number of transactions given covers the number of job vacancies entered onto the Universal Jobmatch service by employers. A vacancy relates to a job role and there may be one or more 'openings' related to a vacancy.
The total volume includes vacancies notified to UJ's predecessor services which were then entered onto the new service. This type of internal management information does not form part of the official statistics outputs that are released by the Department in accordance with the UK Statistics Authorityâ€™s Code of Practice.

info:

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info:
This process is part of Jobsearch Advice service and all the costs are already included in the unit cost of Adviser Interventions (jobsearch advice) 
The costs for 2012 to 2013 included the costs of its predecessors, Employer Direct, National Email Team, Jobseeker Direct Online.
Data source: Department for Work and Pensions
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.
